Class CurrentUserAccounts

  • java.lang.Object
    • CurrentUserAccounts

  • public class CurrentUserAccounts
extends java.lang.Object
    CurrentUserAccounts Provides methods and attributes for interacting with the current user accounts file in memory, and outputting to disk.
    Author:
    Jonathan Gillett, Daniel Smullen, Rayan Alfaheid

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String cuaFile 
      private java.util.ArrayList<User> users 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CurrentUserAccounts(java.lang.String cuaFile)
      Constructor for the class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addUser(User user)
      Adds a User object to the current user accounts file collection.
      void deleteUser(java.lang.String username)
      Removes a User object from the current user accounts file collection, based on the user's name.
      java.util.ArrayList<User> getAllUsers()
      Access method for the contents of the current user accounts file.
      User getUser(java.lang.String username)
      Access method for a particular User object in the collection, by name.
      boolean hasUser(java.lang.String username)
      Determines whether a specified User exists in the current user accounts file, corresponding to the username specified.
      private void parse()
      Parses the current user accounts file entries, matching the specified format based on regular expressions.
      void write()
      Writes the current user accounts file in memory to file, over-writing the old current user accounts file.

    • Field Detail

      • users

        private java.util.ArrayList<User> users

      • cuaFile

        private java.lang.String cuaFile

    • Constructor Detail

      • CurrentUserAccounts

        public CurrentUserAccounts(java.lang.String cuaFile)
                    throws FatalError,
                           java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Constructor for the class. Takes the path to the available tickets file, and opens it.
        Parameters:
        cuaFile - The path to the current user accounts file. Unix-style paths only.
        Throws:
        FatalError - Fatal errors occur under the following circumstances:
        The Current User Accounts file is missing, or not found at the path specified.
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException

    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        public void addUser(User user)
        Adds a User object to the current user accounts file collection.
        Parameters:
        user - The User object to add to the current user accounts file collection.

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser(java.lang.String username)
        Removes a User object from the current user accounts file collection, based on the user's name. If there exists no User object with the specified username, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        username - String containing the name of the user to delete.

      • getAllUsers

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> getAllUsers()
        Access method for the contents of the current user accounts file.
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of User objects, which is the contents of the entire current user accounts file collection.

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String username)
        Access method for a particular User object in the collection, by name. If there exists no User object with the username specified, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        username - String specifying the username of the User object to match to.
        Returns:
        Returns a User object with the username specified. Returns null if no User object with that name exists.

      • hasUser

        public boolean hasUser(java.lang.String username)
        Determines whether a specified User exists in the current user accounts file, corresponding to the username specified.
        Parameters:
        username -
        Returns:
        Returns true if the username specified is in the current user accounts file. Returns false if the username is not found.

      • write

        public void write()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the current user accounts file in memory to file, over-writing the old current user accounts file.
        Throws:
        FatalError - Fatal errors occur under the following circumstances:
        The current user accounts file is corrupted.
        java.io.IOException

      • parse

        private void parse()
            throws FatalError,
                   java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Parses the current user accounts file entries, matching the specified format based on regular expressions.
        Throws:
        FatalError - Fatal errors occur under the following circumstances:
        The Current User Accounts File is missing, or not found at the path specified.
        The current user accounts file is corrupted.
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
